oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ryman Auditorium interior from right rear

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Auditoriums; Stages (Platforms); Concert halls; Historic buildings; Tabernacles (Buildings)
Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Country music; Country gospel music; Music-halls; Historic American Buildings Survey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interior of the Ryman Auditorium shows stage and seats from right rear. Various signs around the auditorium read "No Smoking," "No Standing," "Grand Ole Opry."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jack E. Boucher
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is one of the series of photographs taken of the Ryman Auditorium between 1970 and 1972 for the Historic American Buildings Survey (HABS), a proposal put before the National Park Service during the Great Depression. This 1933 proposal called for documenting the historic architecture of America. HABS went on to become a permanent program of the National Park Service.
